title: Kansas Firm Recalls Pork Products That Were Produced Without a HACCP Plan
summary: WASHINGTON, March 15, 2013 - Ben-Lee Processing, Inc., an Atwood, Kansas establishment, is recalling an undetermined amount of ready-to-eat and heat-treated bacon and ham products that were produced without a Hazard Analysis & Critical Control Points (HACCP) plan, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety...
impacted_products: Various weight packages of cured pork products, including country style bacon, sliced bacon, ham, sliced ham, and summer sausages
